text: Bosen ket's big idea was that to tackle
poverty you need to do more than just
dole out money you have to intervene
early with chaotic families that view is
still pretty popular we need to tackle
the root causes of poverty homes where
no one works children growing up in
chaos addiction mental health problems
abuse
family breakdown we will never deal with
poverty unless we get to grips with
these issues
what sympathy does the man who spent six
years in charge of benefits have for
Bazin ket's approach sometimes people
grow up in a household for example where
your parents didn't work and you imbibe
a a sense that work isn't that important
in your life you don't go to school very
much and therefore you enter the world
of work with no skilling and no sense
that this is what you do that in a sense
you need to put right so you have to do
like her you would intervene at that
point I remember visiting a lone parent
a few years ago in an estate which had a
very high number of single parents young
women and when I sat and talked to her I
sensed that she wanted to do something
she wanted to be better than her
circumstances but she had no skills she
had fallen out of school you shouldn't
know where to go and I remember leaving
there thinking very simply this is my
daughter
I'm sorry I've got version Alyssa 19
years old my aspiration for my daughter
was boundless hmm and here I'm sitting
with a 19 year old girl who had written
off her life and had no aspiration and
no self-worth she was a product of the
system and my point was what could I
have done what could we do to change her
life
so that really is heart as well as head
yeah you want people to be responsible
you want them to make choices you want
them to improve themselves
that's quite Victorian you want people
to make every step of the way as much as
they can to be able to then be masters
of their their own fate not leaving me
as master of their own destiny
yeah Helen Burton Kay would love this
exactly
